newsitem.title: USA: Universal Int'l sees '97 restructure costs.
newsitem.headline: Universal Int'l sees '97 restructure costs.

text.p: Universal International Inc said Wednesday it expects to incur significant costs in 1997 as part of its efforts to restructure and downsize its wholesale operations.

"While the company anticipates that future wholesale operations will be significantly scaled down from current levels and will take a much smaller proportion of corporate operating expenses to run, the company expects to incur significant expenses in reducing its wholesale business throughout the remainder of 1997," Universal said.

Universal on Wednesday reported a 1996 net loss of $0.88 per primary share versus a profit of $0.26. The company cited costs of opening new Only Deals stores, lower-than-planned retail sales and gross margins and lower wholesale net sales.

Since March, Universal has been reducing wholesale inventories and restructuring and downsizing wholesale operations. The company said the size of future wholesale operations is still uncertain, but it intends to focus on retail operations.
